name: drumroll
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the sound of many quick beats played one after the other on a drum: circus stunts performed to drum rolls
informal used when you wait before telling people something that you think they will really want to know: The mystery box contains (drumroll) pearls.
More examplesFewer examplesHe had to keep a drumroll going for the whole time that Vasiliev held the ballerina up."Do we have a drum roll?" the TV host quipped as his imitator entered the studio. The emerging answer to the question "Is religion good for your health?" is (drumroll, please) "It depends." And the answers are (drumroll, please)... I'm not going to tell you.
